Chapter I

1.      Login Screen

 

Purpose:

This screen prompts the user to fill in the user-id & the password to authenticate the user & limit the un-authorized access to the application.

 

          Incase a wrong password is entered; the system would display the message Invalid Password.

          If the user-id entered does not exist, the screen would display the message User-id doesn't exists.

          Select the Company. It has some predefined options in the UDC. Click on the plus sign to open the list of

      options.

          Select the Role. It has some predefined options in the UDC. Click on the plus sign to open the list of

      options.

 

The user can re-enter the user-id & password and when the system accepts the password, it displays the menu screen.

After entering all the information, click Submit button to login or click the Reset button to enter the details again.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Chapter II

 

           

1.      UDC and UDC Type

 

Purpose:

 

The values of the user defined code indicate the valid set of data that is specific to your business for a particular field. Each user defined code is either hard-coded or soft-coded. You can customize fields in your system by setting up user defined codes to meet the needs of your business environment. User defined codes are stored in tables that relate to a specific system and code type.

 

When you enter a value in a user defined code field the application checks the associated table to make sure it is a valid value. If no match is found, the program returns an error message Type Mismatch.

A)        Adding Or Changing a User defined Code Type

 

A code type categorizes your user defined code values within a product code. When you add user defined code values, you are adding them to a specific code type; and therefore the code type must already exist before adding any values to it.

 

On the system Administration Menu

 

1.       Choose a code type to change or click Add to create a new type. Note (The code with Flag=1 means you

                  cannot change this UDC as this has been defined for a particular company).

2.       To add a new code type, in the last row of the grid, complete the following fields.

a)                  Product Code (can give any number to your UDC)

b)                  UDC Type (Should be max of  max 5 characters)

c)                   Text (Description)

d)                  Company (company that UDC belongs to, or you can leave it blank which means it

                        belongs to all)

e)                  Flag (If flag=0 means you can update this UDC, if flag=1 means you cannot modify it)

 

3.       You can change or add multiple code types during the same session by pressing Enter, Click OK buttons

      When you have finished.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

B)        To Edit UDC Type and UDC

1.       Select any UDC and click on update button it will open a new window where you can edit the already

                  filled information. See the below screens shot

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Chapter III

1.      What is Template

Purpose:

 

The purpose of the Template Entry Screen is to create a predefined list of call and task that will help to populate the list of task under that particular call only if its type matches.

 

Template entry will come from Administration Center Menu. Below is the template view screen

 

 

 

 

2.      How to Create a Template

 

To create a new template click on add button. This button will take you to template detail screen where you can create your own template.

 

 

 

A)          Template Detail- To enter new template, this screen will have 3 drop down panels

 

 

i)                    Template Detail- Under this panel we will have following fields

 

 

NOTE:- There will always be three type of Template

 

1.       Call and Task Template (CNT) If we select CNT type of Template then unless and until

                  user don't fill call detail information he cant move to the next level or panel which is

                  Task Detail. For this template you have to create a call and assign task.

2.       Call Only Template (CAO)- User is only need to fill the call detail information

3.       Task Only Template (TAO)- User can straight away go to third level or panel i.e Task Detail

      panel to

4.       Create the task template after filling the information in template detail.

 

Template Name- Enter the name of the template make sure you don't enter the duplicate name.

Template Type- Select the template type

Customer/Company- For whom you want to create this template for

Call Type- Select the task type for which this template should be made

 

 

 

B)                Call Detail- This panel will be same what we have in our call detail screen

 

 

The following fields will be automatically filled as soon as we fill the template detail information

1.             Call Type

2.             Customer

 

 Call Type:                   It has some predefined options in the UDC. Click on the Plus sign, and a pop up window will

open, we can select the call type from there.

 

Call Date:                     By default, it automatically picks up the current date.

 

Call Entered By:          By default, it takes the current user name.

 

Priority:                    It has some predefined options in the UDC like-Normal, Urgent, Minimum,

Maximum, High and Low.

 

Customer:                  It has some predefined options in the UDC.

 

Call Owner:                It has some predefined option from the UDC. On clicking the plus sign next to

it, will open a pop up window and we can select the option from there.

 

Project:                     Select the project for whom you want to create this template F.ex. WSS

 

 

Template Type:           There are three types of template. They are predefined in the UDC. On clicking

the plus sign, a pop up window will open and we can select the template type

from there.

 

Template:                  It has some predefined options. Every template has some predefined tasks and

actions (depending upon the type of template), so we can select the appropriate

template depending upon the new call.

 

 

 

 

Cat Code 1, Cat Code2, Cat Code 3 - It accepts only Numeric values.

 

Status:                      When we open a new call, then the status is OPEN, When we assign the call to the

task owner, then the status is ASSIGNED.

 

Subject:                    Enter the Subject of the call.

 

Description:               Give a brief description of the call.

 

 

Attachments:            We can attach files as attachments with this call. Click on the Attachments Icon

, a pop up window will open, we can Browse the file and then attach it.

 

 

 

c)                 Task Detail- Under this panel we will have following fields

 

 

 

C:                Comment Once the task is entered, the icon for the comment appears. On clicking the Icon, a window appears where we can enter the comment and

save it.

 

A:                    Attachment If under this column, an Icon is displayed, then it indicates that this Task has a file attached with it. Click on Icon , and it will open a

window with a list of all the attachment files for this Task. To View the files, Double click the file and it will open the file.

F:               If under this column, an Icon  is displayed, then it indicates that this task has a form associated with it. Click on the Form Icon  and it will open a

window with a list of all the forms associated with this task.

- This Icon indicates that the form has no data.

- this Icon indicates that the form has data.

 

Subject        Enter the Subject of the call

 

TType               Task Type-Select TType from the drop down menu.. It has some predefined options.

 

Owner             Select the Owner from the drop down menu. It displays a list all the users.

 

Dep             It's optional. Select the value from the drop down menu.

 

EstClDate     Estimated Close Date-The close date of the calendar can be selected from the calendar. Click on the calendar Icon to open the calendar.

 

EHr             Estimated Hours-enter the estimated hours needed to complete the task.

 

Act                 If this check box is checked, then it becomes mandatory to enter the Actions for this task. Unless and until, actions are filled for this task, task cannot be

closed. Incase of mandatory, "M" is displayed, indicating that Actions are to be filled before closing the task.

 

Pri              Priority-It indicates the priority of the task. It has some predefined options which can be selected from the drop down menu.

 

Proj            Project-Name of the project can be entered. It's optional.

 

Agmt             Agreement-It's optional. It has some pre-defined values which can be selected form the drop down menu.

Chapter V

1.      How to create User Profile

Purpose:

The purpose of this function is to set the correct security on the user. The user information is in the

Address Book. We have to create a User Profile with a Unique User Name and Password.

 

 

The above screen displays the List of all the existing Users with description about the AddBookNo, UserID, UserType,ValidUpto, Status and Company. To create a new User Profile for a New User, Click on Add New Icon.  This will open up a new screen.

 

 

 

Enter the User ID for the New User, then enter the Password and Confirm the password again.Address No  Once entry of the New User

has been made in the Address Book, then it auto creates

an Address No. So, it has a pre-defined list

 

 

User Type        It has two pre-defined options, Internal or External. We can select the appropriate option from

the Drop Down Menu

 

 

From Date       It is the Date on which the User profile is created. By Default it takes the

Current Date automatically.

To Date            It is the Date, till when the User Profile will remain Active. We can select

the Date from the Calendar.

             We can click on the Calendar Icon to open the Calendar.

 

 

 Now , we can select the Expiry Date of the User Account.

 

Status                           Status has two pre-defined optionsEnabled and Disabled.

 

 

 We can select the appropriate option from the drop down menu.

If ENABLED is selected, then the user will be able to Login. and if DISABLED is selected, then the user will not be able to Login.

 

Password Expiry Limit --- It is automatically 356 days. We cannot change this field.

                       

                       

 

Roles                Select the type of role that you want to assign to the new user. For example, Sales Role, HR Role etc. 

                       

 

 

Role Name-      It has some pre-defined options . To see the options window, click on the small plus sign.

 

Assigned Date It automatically sets the current date.

 

 

 

 

Valid Upto        From the calendar, we can select the valid upto date. To open the calendar, click on the calendar Icon.            

                       

Status               Status has two pre-defined optionsenabled and Disabled.

 

 

 We can select the appropriate option from the drop down menu.

If ENEBLED is selected, then the particular Role will get enabled and the user will be able to Login with that Role. And if, DISABLED is selected, then the User will not be able to Login with that Role.

This is used when a User has been provided lot of Roles.

                         

Assigned By    By default, it picks the name of the user who is creating the New role.

Chapter VI

 

1.      How to provide security to a Role

Purpose:

            The Purpose of this screen is to give and take away the access of different modules, screens, fields and

buttons to different user/role of different companies. 

 

 

 

This screen displays the list of all the Role Names with their respective unique ID's. After we have entered the information in the Address Book and created the User Profile, next task is to assign the Role Security. In this we can enable and disable or hide, the options that we don't want the new user to see and change. This is for the security purposes.

 

When we have several user's, we don't want all the users to have all the access rights, so from the Role Security, we can give the selected rights to the users.

 

For Example, Admin has all the rights to View and make changes anywhere. Where as, we don't want all the

users to have all rights. So we can restrict the rights depending upon what kind of Role is assigned to the user.

 

From Role, we can select the access level at the Menu, screen and controls level.

 

A)        At Menu Level

 

From here, we can VIEW or HIDE, the screens that we don't want the user to access. For Example, if we Hide the Support and Change Menu's, then under that particular user's Login, he wont see these menu's.

So he won't be able to view data and information under these Menu's and further, he wont be able to make any changes.

 

 

 

B)        Screen Level

 

Then we can select a particular Menu, and further we can apply security at the Screen Level.

 

 

 

From here, we can again, View and Hide, the particular screens, that we don't want the user to view and make changes. If we select View, then user will be able to view all the information and data under that particular screen. He can navigate through the records.

 

If we select Hide, then he won't be able to view the screen. So he can't even see the information and data in that particular screen.

 

Further, we can also hide, Disable and Enable the buttons on these screens. Select a screen, and then in the Controls we can select the rights that we want to give.

 

 

c)        Control Level

 

 

From here, we can Hide, View, Disable and enable the buttons according to the access level that we want to provide to the user.  

 

If we select Hide, user won't be able to see that button. If we select Disabled, the button will be disabled, i.e. no action will happen on clicking the button.

 

For Example, for Delete button, if we make it View and Disabled then, user will be able to View the button the screen but if he clicks on it nothing with happens as its disabled.

 

So, this is for the Security purpose, the user will not be able to Delete any records.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Chapter VII

 

1.      Call Entry

 

Purpose:

 

All things in WSS start with a CALL. A CALL can be an error, a question, a project task etc. A CALL is the

log of something needed to be executed.

 

 

 

Call Entry is done on this screen. After entering all the information, we can save the call, then we can fill

the corresponding tasks and actions for this call.

 

Customer: It has some predefined options in the UDC. Click on the Plus sign and the pop

up window will open. We can select the option from there.

 

Project:                     Project is a mandatory field here. Call Will not be saved if Project is not selected.

It has pre-defined options from the UDC and it displays the name of the various

projects. 

 

Agreement:                 It has some predefined options from the UDC. We can select the agreement

no/Type from the UDC.

 

Call Type:                   It has some predefined options in the UDC. Select the one that suits your need.

 

Call Owner:                It has some predefined option from the UDC. On clicking the plus sign next to it,

will open a pop up window and we can select the option from there.

Priority:                    It has some predefined options in the UDC like-Normal, Urgent, Minimum,

maximum, high or Low.

 

Call Date:                     By default, it automatically picks up the current date.

 

Est Finish Date:          Here, we can specify the finish date of the call. On clicking the calendar icon,

a calendar will open, and then we can select the date from there.

 

Reference:                   To give any reference to your call for quick search

 

Call Entered By:          By default, it takes the current user name who is logged in.

 

 

Template Type:           There are three types of template. They are predefined in the UDC for eg (Call

and task type, Task only and call only.) Select any one the template and it will

open a new pop-up window which will show you the template that has been created

under that template type.

 

Template:                  This field will fill up automatically whatever selection you have made in the template

type field

 

Cat Code 1, Cat Code2, Cat Code 3 It accepts only Numeric values. These fields are optional.

 

  Status:                     When we open a new call, then the status is OPEN, When we assign the call to

the task owner, then the status is ASSIGNED. When, the task owner enters the

respective tasks and actions on the call, then status becomes PROGRESS. And

finally, when all the task are closed, then status is CLOSED. We can also re-open

the call, then status will become RE-OPEN.

 

 

STATUS

Open a new call

OPEN

Assign Task 

ASSIGNED

Enter Actions

PROGRESS

 

 Comment:                We can add a special comment on the call. Click on the Comment Icon 

 and a pop up window will open. We can type the comment there

and save it. After adding the comment, the color of the Icon changes to Yellow,

indicating that there is a special comment attached here. If the comment is unread,

then in the icon , there will be three-four black lines, indicating that the comment

is still unread and after reading the comment the black lines disappear.

User will be able to add a comment only after saving the new call.

 

 Attachments:           We can attach files as attachments with this call. Click on the Attachments Icon

, a pop up window will open, we can Browse the file and then attach it by

clicking the Upload button.

 

Subject:                    Enter the Subject of the call. (Mandatory)

 

Description:                 Give a brief description of the call. (Mandatory)

 

  

 Buttons

 

OK If clicked on OK button this will save your entry and take you to the call view screen

 SAVE                            After, entering the new call, we can click on the SAVE button to save the new call.

 REFRESH                        It will refresh the page, all changes that were not saved will be deleted.

 DELETE                           It will delete the records.

 ATTACHMENT                  With this button, we can attach files with the call.

 CALL FORWARD              We can forward the task to the other person, using this button.                                                      

 CANCEL                       If we want to cancel the changes made.

 

HELP Gives the brief description of the current screen.

LOGOUT Used to logout from WSS.

 

A)        How to Create a New Call

Enter the new call data, attach any files if needed, then click on the SAVE button

 to save the new call in the records. The status of the new will be OPEN, once the task

is assigned, then the status will automatically become ASSIGNED. Further, on entering the Actions,

the status of the call will become PROGRESS.

 

 

 

 

  Once the call is saved, we can fill the Tasks on the same screen in the Task Panel. And after filling the tasks,

we can also fill the Actions in the Action Panel on the same screen.

 

B)        How to Assign a New Task and Action

 

 

            Assigning a Task

 

 C:                             Comment-- Once the task is entered, the icon for the comment appears. On

clicking the Icon, a window appears where we can enter the comment and

save it. Comment can be Internal/External. Internal comment cannot be viewed by

the client but external comment can be viewed by all. User can also send email to

Chapter XII

 

1.               Free Search

Purpose:

Search is used to search and fetch a specific word or words from the entire database. We can also do an

advanced search by selecting the levels of the search.

 

                

 

    Free Search is used for searching with a keyword, by selecting the various criteria's

    In the search criteria, we can select the company, project and the domain from which we want the

    keyword to be searched.

 

   The Company has some pre-defined values from the UDC. For example, ION, LF etc.

   The Project also has some pre-defined values from the UDC. For Example, WSS, Anaha etc.

               In the Domain, we can select the level from where we want to search the keyword like call, task, action,

               Call and Task, Call and Action etc.. It has some pre-defined values from the UDC.

 

NOTE : Selecting the Company is mandatory. Project and Domain are optional.

 

 A)        How to Advance Search

 

             

 

In the Advanced Criteria Panel, we can select some advanced conditions and criteria's for the search.

We can select the Call no From and To. Here, we can put the call no's from where we want to search

the keyword.

 

We can also select the Date From and To i.e search in all the calls for the keyword specified between

the date.

B)        How to search on different levels

We can select the levels of the search i.e. at call level, task level or at action level.

If we select the call level search, then it will search for the specified keyword in the call subject. Description,

comment, attachment, Call type etc.

 

We can select the options in the check boxes.

For Example, if we want to select for the word which is in the subject, then we can check the subject check

box and it will search for the particular specified subject. Similarly for others.

 

The result of the Search is displayed in the results panel.

           

In the above screen shot, search was made on the word Testing for the company ION,  in the domain call.

Search was done at the call, task and action levels and the result was given showing two calls that contained

the word testing. We can click the result data to view the details of the call.

 

NOTE: For searching, if we are not sure of the complete word then we can add strings also.

For example, *te*. After search, in the results it will show all the calls which contain the alphabets te, no

matter what data they have in the front and back of te.

 

Another Example, if we want to search for a word starting from Test and ending at anything, then  we can enter

Test* in the search box. The special Character * will indicate that the word should start from Test and it can end

with anything, so it will look for all the word starting from test.

 

Another Example, for the word Automation, we can simply enter Auto*.

It will search for all the words in all the calls starting from auto and ending with anything.

 

Buttons

 

 REFRESH             It will refresh the page, all changes that were not saved will be deleted.

CLOSE It will close the current window.

HELP Gives the brief description of the current screen.

LOGOUT Used to logout from WSS.

Chapter XIII

 

1.      Escalation

 

Purpose:

 

 

Rules for when a call have not been touch for that many days or are overdue or close to overdue. You

as a manager can be notified when a Task / Call is overdue or close, according to the rules you place

in this table.

 

 

           

 

 

Major cases related to escalation time and Frequency parameters

 

Escalation Time    Frequency       Description_________________________

 

0                            0                      Start immediately and once a time

 

0                            1                      Start immediately and repeat after 1 hour

 

1                            0                      Start after/before 1 day and once a time

 

1                            1                      Start after/before 1 day and repeat after 1 hour

 

For Additive/Conditional

 

0                            0                      immediately and once a time

 

                        all cases are same as above defined

 

Special cases of Additive/Conditional

 

 0                           -1                     Ignore Frequency

 

-1                           0                     Ignore Escalation time

 

-1                           -1                     Ignore both

 

 

 

For entering the data in case of Additive or conditional just leave blank Time and Frequency boxes.

System will automatically convert that blank value into -1.

 

 

If you want to escalate how many days in advance you would like to be notice before the Call or Task is

past due. Example 1 day means you are going to be notified 1 day before the Call / Task has it finish date. 

 

0 means that you will be noticed when it should be completed BUT if the Task or Call is closed then the rule

does not apply.

 

 

Chapter XIV

1.      Communication Setup

 

 

 

 

Communication setup is designed to set up the mode to communicate with a person on specific events.

The two modes used are either by Email or by SMS. We can specify rules , like on which events mail/sms

should be sent to the respective persons.

 

For Example, we can create a rule, if a new call is opened, then the call owner should get a mail. So, as

soon as a new call will be opened, call owner will receive a mail for conformation.

 

We can also create a rule, if any task is assigned or an Action is filled, Call owner should get a mail. So,

whenever a task will be assigned for that call, a mail will be sent immediately to the call owner. Similarly,

for Action filled.

 

 

 SAVE                   Save the changes made.

 EDIT                   It will open the call edit screen and we can edit the call and its details.

 SEARCH                Type any keyword in the search boxes and then click on this button, it will

only display the matching results.

 REFRESH              It will refresh the page, all changes that were not saved will be deleted.

 

HELP Gives the brief description of the current screen.

LOGOUT Used to logout from WSS.

 

A) How to Create a Rule

 

 

RNo is the Role no, which is automatically assigned after the Rule is created.

M-Mail, click this check box for communication through mail

S-SMS, Click this check box for communication through SMS.

Start Date- it picks up the current date automatically

Stop Date  Its optional.

Event  From the drop down menu, we can select the pre-defined events.

For Example, Call Open, Task Assign, Action Filled, Task Fwd, Conditional, Additive, Call Closed, Task

Closed.

 

Additive Rule : This rule is used a new User to the Default rule.

 

Additive rule is created, if a call priority is HIGH, then a mail should be sent to Nisha

 

Conditional : This rule is used to put condition for communication, on the user for a default rule.

Example :

 

 

Conditional rule is created that whenever an action if filled, and if Admin is involved in the call cycle, then

no mail no sms should be sent to admin.

 

Default User- from the drop down menu, we can select the user.

OnEvent- from the drop down menu, we can select the event. Its optional.

 

So, similarly, we can select the options and then Save the Rule.

B) How to Edit a Rule

 

Double click the rule , it will open a window, as shown below. Make the changes and Save the

changes by clicking the Save button.

 

 

Buttons

OK Save and Exit from the current screen

 SAVE                   Save the changes made.

 REFRESH              It will refresh the page, all changes that were not saved will be deleted.

 CANCEL                If we want to go out of this screen use the cancel button. It will close the current window.

 

C) How to Disable a Created Rule

To disable a particular rule, select Dsb from the last drop down box. Enb is for Enabled.

On Selecting Dsb , the value in the last Column for that rule will become 0, which indicates

that this rule is disabled and it will grey out also. If a Rule is Enabled, then the status column

will show 1 value.

 

 

D) What are Alerts and How to set an alert

 

We can set Alerts on a particular call or task. With this if there is any change in the Status of the

Call or Task, a mail will be sent immediately. To set the Alert , select the Task then click on the

Alert Button, . Further, if any changes are made to the task or call, it will be notified

immediately.

 

 

 

ADD NEW           It saves the changes and closes the current window.

 SAVE                   After, entering the new call, we can click on the SAVE button to save the new call.

 EDIT                   It will open the call edit screen and we can edit the call and its details.

 SHOW/ HIDE       If we click on this button once, it will SHOW call the calls and if we click it

second time, it hides all the closed calls and only shows the calls in progress

and assigned status.

 SEARCH                Type any keyword in the search boxes and then click on this button, it will

only display the matching results.

 ATTACHMENT        With this button, we can attach files with the call or task.

Call Monitor This button is used to put any call under monitoring

 CANCEL                If we want to go out of this screen use the cancel button.

 

HELP Gives the brief description of the current screen.

LOGOUT Used to logout from WSS.

 

E) How to set an Alert

Double click the Task/Call on which alerts is to added, it will open a window as shown below.

 

 

Select the criteria, from the drop down boxes, select the options and then select the Check

box for mail/sms and then save the criteria. After saving, the criteria will be shown in the Communication

setup rules panel, as shown in the above screen shot.

BUTTONS

OK           It saves the changes and closes the current window.

 SAVE                   After, entering the new call, we can click on the SAVE button to save the new call.

 CANCEL                If we want to go out of this screen use the cancel button.

 REFRESH              It will refresh the page, all changes that were not saved will be deleted.

 EDIT                   It will open the call edit screen and we can edit the call and its details.

 

 

 

Chapter XV

 

1.      Comments

 

Purpose:

 

This screen is a tool which will work as a communication between many people related to the task/call/action. You will find comment icon  on call level, task level and

action level. Double click on the icon and it will display a comment screen with the call No. and Task.No Write a comment in the given column and press OK or SAVE

button.

 

 

 

External/Internal- You will find two options under this drop down field where external means if you want to make your comments public Whereas internal means to

make your comments private (only you can view your comment)

 

Send Mail- This button is used to send the comment through email to any concerned person Double click on this button and a new pop-up screen will open named as

WSS users. Select the email ID to whom you think the mail should go and then click on OK button

 

You will come to do the comment screen now save the comment . Once you save the comment icon which was earlier appearing in grey turned out yellow and with lines

 once the comment is read the line will disappear and the icon will look like this
